meanings.definition: Of or relating to the cuticle.
meanings.sent1: The cuticular layer of the skin protects us from harm.
meanings.sent2: Her hair had a shiny cuticular sheen that caught the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The cuticular gloves made him feel like a superhero!
meanings.sent4: The cuticular barrier between them seemed impenetrable.
meanings.sent5: The cuticular texture of the leaf felt like delicate lace.

meanings.definition: Consisting of or resembling a cuticle.
meanings.sent1: The plant's cuticular surface was smooth to the touch.
meanings.sent2: The cuticular material of the jacket repelled water effectively.
meanings.sent3: The cuticular appearance of the cake made it look too perfect to eat!
meanings.sent4: Her cuticular nails were so well-maintained, they looked like glass.
meanings.sent5: The cuticular pattern on the butterfly's wings was mesmerizing.
